title: HR Business Partner (Bilingual in Mandarin required)
description:
Job Summary:  
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Human Resources Business Partner to join our team. As an HR Business Partner, you will be responsible for providing strategic HR support and guidance to our organization. You will work closely with management to align HR initiatives with business objectives and drive the overall success of the company.

Key Responsibilities:

* Strategic HR Planning: Collaborate with senior leadership to develop and implement HR strategies that align with the company's goals and objectives.
* Talent Acquisition: job postings, candidate screening, interviews, and onboarding for various positions within the organization.
* Employee Relations: Act as a trusted advisor to management and employees, providing guidance on employee relations issues, conflict resolution, and performance management.
* Training and Development: Identify training needs, design and implement training programs to enhance employee skills and competencies, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
* Performance Management: Manage the performance appraisal process, providing guidance to managers and employees on setting goals, conducting evaluations, and addressing performance issues.
* Employee Engagement: Develop and implement initiatives to promote employee engagement, satisfaction, and retention, including employee surveys, recognition programs, and team-building activities.

* Office administration: Purchases, payment applications, service provider engagement and communications as needed by the office.
* Internal and external coordination: Response to and communication with other departments and the management within the group, service providers, government agencies and other parties that are involved in HR and office administration.
* Support and ownership of other tasks and responsibilities that may be communicated by the management.

* Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field. Master's degree or HR certification
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in human resources, with a focus on strategic HR business partnering.
* Experience in the freight forwarding or logistics industry is a plus.

title: Data Coordinator and Developer for Music Publishing Software
description:
Data Coordinator and Developer For Music Publishing Software

Use your skills, experience and talents at an industry-leading music publisher. At Carl Fischer Music, one of the oldest sheet music publishers in the United States, we have over 150 years-worth of digital and terrestrial data that need to be harvested, standardized, and verified for accuracy. In the 21 st Century, it is vital for us to have accurate data about our works and it has a direct impact on dealer- and consumer-facing avenues.

As Data Coordinator and Developer, you will be responsible for the accuracy of work, product, contract, and composer data, as well as documenting and enforcing data best practices across all company avenues. Most data is integrated into our internal data management software. This is the ideal job for musicians who have music librarian experience; many of the same skills will translate to our data challenges, much of which is music-specific.

This position is full time and based in our NY office in the financial district.

**Our Company History**

For over 150 years Carl Fischer Music has been a leader in educational music publishing. Since its founding in 1872, Carl Fischer Music has had a deep and abiding commitment to sharing traditional and contemporary music with the world.

**A little about the Development team**

Based in New York City and Sri Lanka, the development team is a combination of musicians and nonmusicians with a passion for technology and development. We are the backbone of the company, our code and queries touching nearly every department. We are constantly trying to improve and modernize our technology stack and workflows to make everything run better and smoother.

Primary Roles:

* Become an expert/administrator/champion for our product information management system,
* Use the Chordata REST API to create integrations, services, and reports for company needs. Be on the front lines of Chordata usage and act as the primary contact for everything Chordata related. Understand how it is being used across departments, and where it falls short.
* Use direct SQL queries to the Chordata database under certain circumstances.
* Collaborate with the Development team to implement improvements to Chordata software.
* Ensure data quality best practices are met and drive continuous improvement. Identify gaps in the data model that may prove useful to other users. Implement a plan for harvesting that data if required.
* Data cleaning and ETL.
* Maintain database backup and recovery infrastructure to protect against data loss.

No candidate is expected to check all of these boxes, if you think you’d be a good fit on the Development team at Carl Fischer, please get in touch!

Requirements:

* Some experience with PHP (or other scripting languages such as Node.js or Python)
* Some experience with SQL
* Some experience or familiarity with SOAP or REST APIs
* Some experience with client-side JavaScript, HTML, and CSS
* Comfortable in the Unix shell
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel
* Ability to work efficiently and independently
* Ability to effectively apply critical thinking to difficult problems
* Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Library Science, or Music preferred but not required

Bonus Features:

* Experience with classical music scores and instruments. Being a classical musician is not a requirement but it will help to better understand some challenges.
* Prior experience working with web application frameworks and tools (Vue.js, Laravel, Magento, Wordpress, etc.)
* Experience in Access or advanced Excel skills
* Experience with file server administration
* Direct experience with cataloging music scores, such as in a music library.
* Previous experience in a customer facing environment
* Experience with Docker or other development virtualization tools
* Knowledge of text or music OCR systems.
* Experience with Elasticsearch or any other search engine technology
* Experience with Linux

Compensation will depend upon prior experience. Excellent benefits package offered after 3 months of employment.

To apply, send a current resume and cover letter.

We are committed to treating all applicants and associates fairly based on their abilities, achievements, and experience without regard to race, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other classification protected by law.

title: FSO, Business Consulting Financial Regulatory Reporting Manager
description:
EY focuses on high-ethical standards and integrity among its employees and expects all candidates to demonstrate these qualities. At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.  

This position could be in NY, NC, TX, IL, VA.

**Finance Transformation, Regulatory Reporting Manager**


 EY is the only professional services firm with a separate business unit ("FSO") that is dedicated to the financial services marketplace. Our FSO teams have been at the forefront of every event that has reshaped and redefined the financial services industry. If you have a passion for rallying together to solve the most complex challenges in the financial services industry, come join our dynamic FSO team!

  

**The opportunity**


Recognizing the changing and fast-paced professional landscape, you will work with our clients to better align their regulatory reporting operating infrastructures within their business strategies. You will support client teams and engagement leadership to bring our broad range of capabilities and insights to enhance the role and effectiveness of the regulatory reporting, finance, and operations functions. You will work collaboratively with colleagues in Data, Technology, Strategy and Risk to execute on our latest solutions to not only improve operational efficiencies, but to enhance the changing role of the CFO as an indispensable partner tasked with providing better business insights, profitability and performance measurement.

**Your key responsibilities**

* Support client engagement teams at a wide variety of FSO clients to deliver professional services and participate in business development activities on strategic and global priority accounts.
* Serve in an execution role to deliver our latest solutions and capabilities to regulatory reporting functions including data analytics, data tracing, operating model design, managed services, and other regulatory activities.
* Advise clients on a variety of business process issues that help identify, assess, manage and measure the organization's capabilities. Rely upon business process, organizational / innovative technology capabilities, and knowledge across several of the following focus areas:
	+ Regulatory Reporting transformation (Managed Services, Operating Model Design)
	+ Regulatory Reporting optimization and efficiency
	+ Liquidity and Treasury-related reporting including stress testing and LCR experience.
	+ Risk assessment, prioritization, and analysis of critical risk areas.
	+ Accounting change, accounting policy, and controllership activities
	+ Reporting process rapid assessments
	+ Data tracing from source or data warehouses to final report
	+ Regulatory reporting conformance testing, review, and analysis
	+ Regulatory assessment support
	+ Regulatory and Statutory Reporting strategy and improvement
	+ Participate in engagement management and execution as well as client relationship building and management.

 **To qualify for the role, you must have:**

* A bachelor's degree and approximately 6+ years of related work experience*.*
* A degree with an emphasis in Finance, Accounting, Economics, and/or Business; MBA and/or CPA is preferred.
* 5+ years of experience in providing consulting services in the finance function and other operational areas that impact the finance function (e.g., Financial Close; Budgeting and Planning, Shared Services/Outsourcing)
* Experience with key regulatory reports for banking organizations (e.g., FR Y-14, FR Y-9C, Call Reports, FFIEC 009, etc.)
* Experience in managing Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) implementations.
* Demonstrate characteristics of a forward thinker and self-motivator that thrives on new challenges and adapts quickly to learning new knowledge.
* History of driving revenue within existing clients and in developing new prospects at the "C" level of Fortune 500 companies
* Ability to lead a team of consulting professionals on multiple projects.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills.
* A strong work ethic.
* A willingness to travel to meet client needs; travel is estimated at 50% +
* A valid driver's license in the US and a valid passport required; willingness and ability to travel internationally.

 **Ideally, you'll also**

* Possess a working knowledge and understanding of the overall finance function operations including regulatory reporting specifically.
* Hold a degree in business, finance, accounting, computer science, engineering, or a related field.
* Have prior experience in any of the following areas is a positive:
	+ Assessment and redesign of business, risk and control processes
	+ Refinement of target operating models particularly within the Finance function
	+ Regulatory reporting
	+ Management reporting / financial planning & analysis
	+ Business intelligence/decision support
	+ Business/merger Integration
	+ Reconciliation redesign or improvement
	+ Regulatory and statutory reporting improvement


**What we look for:**  

We are looking for the next generation of outstanding leaders to continue our legacy. Our top performers in the past have demonstrated deep knowledge of the financial services marketplace, strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and an ability to adapt and collaborate in changing circumstances. If you are someone who has an appetite to stay abreast of current business and industry trends, develop in-depth technical capabilities and professional knowledge and demonstrate the ability to assimilate new knowledge, then this role is for you.

  

**What we offer**

We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. The salary range for this job in most geographic locations in the US is $119,900 to $219,800. The salary range for New York City Metro Area, Washington State and California (excluding Sacramento) is $143,900 to $249,800. Individual salaries within those ranges are determined through a wide variety of factors including but not limited to education, experience, knowledge, skills and geography. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.
* **Continuous learning:** You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
* **Success as defined by you:** We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
* **Transformative leadership:** We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
* **Diverse and inclusive culture:** You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

  

EY accepts applications for this position on an on-going basis. **If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.**

  

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

**Position Summary:**


Delta Community Supports, Inc. is seeking a compassionate and efficient Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) to join our dynamic team. Reporting to the Registered Nurse, the LPN will care for and provide support to Delta Community Supports' participants within the Intellectual Disability/Division of Developmental Disabilities (DDD) service programs.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Coordinate medical supports planning for new and existing support recipients.
* Facilitate medical implementation of supports on an as needed basis.
* Monitor medical supports for consistency with person-centered planning as well as the companys mission, values and Individual Supports Policy and Procedures.
* Administer and record medications that require medical personnel on an as needed basis.
* Provide staff with training and resources in health care issues such as but not limited to seizures, hepatitis, diabetes, recognizing signs of illness and special diets.
* Establish Medical Support Guidelines for individual support recipients as necessary and to instruct staff on the implementation of such guidelines.
* Update and publish special precautions lists for individuals with seizure disorders, diet restrictions, allergies, and other illnesses on an as needed basis.
* Maintain liaison with state and regulatory personnel, families, and external sources of support and communicate with consulting psychiatrists, psychologists, and healthcare professionals as needed.

**Qualifications****:**

* Graduate from an accredited school of nursing program
* Current, unrestricted license to practice as a Licensed Practical Nurse in the state of assignment.
* Two (2) years of experience providing community based supports (residential)
* Valid drivers license in the state of residence.
* CPR/First Aid/AED certified.
* Previous experience working with EHR systems (Evolv preferred, but not required).
* 1-2 years of experience working with adults with intellectual disabilities strongly preferred, but not required.

**Benefits****:**

* Variety of available work schedules to accommodate different lifestyles and preferences.

* Commuter benefits to help with transportation costs.
* Hospital insurance coverage for unexpected medical expenses.
* Critical Illness Insurance to provide financial support during serious illnesses.
* Identity Theft protection for peace of mind.
* Legal Assistance for personal and professional matters.
* Company Paid Life Insurance coverage for employees and supplemental Life Insurance for additional coverage.
* Company Paid Short-Term Disability Insurance for Pennsylvania employees, providing financial protection in the event of a short-term disability.
* Long-term Disability (LTD) Insurance coverage to support employees in case of long-term disabilities.
* Company Paid Holidays to celebrate important occasions.

? Perform quality work within deadlines with or without direct supervision.


? Interact professionally with other employees, customers, and suppliers.


? Work effectively as a team contributor on all assignments.

? A minimum of eight years in the event sales/planning/management, destination management or agency experience

? Ability to work flexible work schedules/shifts based on business demands.


? Guest focused, with a helpful, positive, and 'can-do' attitude.


? Be an excellent team player while also showing the drive and enthusiasm to work on their own initiative.


? Self-motivated and work with a sense of urgency, whilst demonstrating excellent attention to detail.


? Ability to see the big picture and help department scale and grow with integrity.


? Ability to interact with diverse and high-volume customer base in a friendly and efficient manner.


? Ability to operate Web based ordering system, process customer requests, changes to orders, updates, and client profiles.

? Flexibility and adaptation in times of change.

? Create spreadsheets, Power Point presentations, and other written collateral.


? Develop and write Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).


? Develop and conduct trainings for Events & Catering staff as needed.


? Consistent and efficient correspondence, coordination and execution of events while maintaining a professional, calm, and composed demeanor.

? Maintain hourly staff payroll in unit timekeeping system in absence of Events & Catering Manager / Assistant Events & Catering Manager.
